This is the 11 June 2018 newsletter tracking the latest Zephyr development merged into the mainline tree on GitHub.

We’ve renamed the series to “Zephyr Development News” to avoid a name clash with a publication produced by another entity.

item.title: Zephyr Newsletter 11 April 2018
item.description:
Zephyr News

This is the first of a periodic (weekly-ish) newsletter tracking the latest Zephyr development merged into the mainline tree on GitHub.

The goals are to give a human-readable summary of what’s been merged into master, breaking it down as follows:

  • Highlights
    • Important changes
    • New features
    • Bug fixes
  • Individual changes: a complete list of patches, sorted chronologically and categorized into areas, like:
    • Architectures
    • Kernel
    • Drivers
    • etc.
